title: Motorola Signature phone is here with 7 years of updates, access to luxury experiences
summary: Could this land in the US as the Motorola Edge 70 Ultra?
body: Credit: Motorola TL;DR Motorola has announced the Motorola Signature smartphone. The phone has a slick design and a well-rounded spec sheet, including the Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 chip and triple 50MP rear cameras. The Signature also offers seven years of updates and access to exclusive experiences. We first heard about an apparent Motorola Signature phone last month. Fortunately, we didn‚Äôt have to wait long for the unveiling, as Motorola has just launched the device. The Motorola Signature is the first phone in the brand‚Äôs new Signature series, and it emphasizes a slick design and premium extras. Starting with the design, Moto says the phone is 6.99mm thick and has an aluminum frame. The Signature is available in Pantone Martini Olive with a twill-inspired finish, or Pantone Carbon with a linen-inspired finish. Motorola‚Äôs phone also packs Gorilla Glass Victus 2 protection and IP68/69 ratings.

title: I used a $699 Android phone that‚Äôs doing everything Google and Samsung won‚Äôt
summary: An Android phone, in 2026, with a removable battery. We're so back.
body: I just saw something at CES 2026 that felt like a relic of the past: an Android phone with strong privacy features, a removable battery, expandable storage, solid specs, and no AI features. It‚Äôs the type of Android phone that Samsung and Google won‚Äôt make, but another company did, and it‚Äôs called the Punkt MC03. Punkt may not be a household name, but it‚Äôs also not brand new to the smartphone world. The company launched its MC02 phone in February 2024 with the same goal of creating a privacy-focused handset. It wasn‚Äôt a complete success, but it was a promising glimpse into Punkt‚Äôs vision for Android‚Äôs future.

title: Optus Stadium, RAC Arena Win Big at Australia‚Äôs 2025 Stadium¬†Awards
summary: The west won as RAC Arena edged out east coast heavyweight Rod Laver Arena in Melbourne to snag best indoor arena for the third consecutive year.
body: BRISBANE, Australia — Powered by concerts from AC/DC , Metallica and a slew of sporting concerts, Optus Stadium is crowned as Australia‚Äôs stadium of the year. The Perth venue takes top honors in the seventh edition of the fan-voted 2025 Stadium Awards , organized by Austadiums, the online resource for Australian and New Zealand venues and events. Optus Stadium secured 27.5% of the public vote, narrowly beating Adelaide Oval (23%) and Brisbane’s Suncorp Stadium (18.2%). The venue‚Äôs ‚Äúcontinued success comes off another major year hosting high-profile AFL matches, international cricket, concerts, and special events,‚Äù reads a statement from Austadiums . ‚ÄúIts riverfront location, modern design, and strong match-day atmosphere continue to resonate with fans nationwide.‚Äù Opening in January 2018, Optus Stadium has a standard seating capacity of 60,000, making it the country‚Äôs third-largest stadium, though the venue can be reconfigured to hold up to 65,000 for rectangular field sports, like soccer and rugby, and more for concerts, lifting to 70,000 or more with temporary seating. It‚Äôs owned by the Western Australian state government and operated by VenuesLive. Optus Stadiu‚Ä¶

title: Deal: Score massive $140 savings on the 2024 Kindle Scribe
summary: Despite now having a successor, it's still a top-tier device ‚Äî especially with 64GB storage.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority If you‚Äôve ever been tempted by Amazon‚Äôs note-taking Kindle but balked at the price, this deal is worth a look. The top storage variant of the 2024 Kindle Scribe is currently down to $309.99, which is a $140 discount on its usual price. For bargain hunters, it‚Äôs undoubtedly one of the more compelling price drops we‚Äôve seen on Amazon‚Äôs large-format eReader. Kindle Scribe (2024, 64GB) for $309.99 ($140 off)

title: The best thing I found at CES 2026 isn‚Äôt a phone or TV ‚Äî it‚Äôs a $75 smart ring
summary: This is the Pebble Index 01.
body: About a year ago at CES 2025, I met with former Pebble CEO Eric Migicovsky to get a sneak peek at a new product he was working on: a smart ring designed specifically for recording notes and reminders at the press of a button. I was immediately intrigued. That ring was announced as the Pebble Index 01 in December, and at CES 2026 this week, I finally got to try it for myself. It‚Äôs unlike any other smart ring I‚Äôve used before, and while it won‚Äôt be for everyone, it‚Äôs easily one of the best things I‚Äôve found at this year‚Äôs CES.

title: This Duolingo alternative changed the way I learn languages
summary: Speak's speak-first approach is proving to be very bueno.
body: My friend is visiting from Colombia for the holidays, and let‚Äôs just say my 700+ days of studying Spanish on Duolingo is really being put to the test. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I can definitely see the progress I‚Äôve made in my Spanish learning journey. I pick up on things when I hear Spanish, and I‚Äôm usually able to piece together what‚Äôs being said. However, contributing to the conversation is an entirely different beast. Duolingo sprinkles speaking exercises into its lessons, but the functionality feels more like a smaller piece of the puzzle rather than the focus. Speak , another language learning app that I‚Äôve been watching from afar over the last few years, turns this strategy on its head, and the difference has been eye-opening to me. Speak first, sweat the details later

title: OnePlus 15T spec leak reveals a gigantic battery for a compact phone
summary: OnePlus might squeeze a ton of juice into a relatively small smartphone.
body: Credit: Aamir Siddiqui / Android Authority TL;DR A leaker has claimed that the OnePlus 15T could have a 7,500mAh battery. The phone is also tipped to have a 6.3-inch 165Hz screen, an ultrasonic fingerprint scanner, and a 50MP tele camera. The OnePlus 13S/13T had a very limited release, but we hope the new phone is widely available. OnePlus launched the OnePlus 13T in China last year, which was known as the OnePlus 13s in India. This was a pocket-friendly phone with flagship performance and a big battery. Now, a prominent leaker has revealed apparent details for the OnePlus 15T. Leaker Digital Chat Station posted purported OnePlus 15T specs on Weibo. For one, the device is said to have a flat 6.3-inch 165Hz screen (1.5K resolution). This screen size would be roughly on par with the OnePlus 13T/13S while offering a higher refresh rate.

title: Debbie Gibson Plugs In For ‚ÄòElectric Youth‚Äô Performance on ‚ÄòKimmel‚Äô:¬†Watch
summary: The chart-topping singer-songwriter, stage and screen actress and now book author had the place partying like it was 1989.
body: Debbie Gibson detonated a blast from the past when she stopped by Jimmy Kimmel Live on Tuesday night (Jan. 6). The chart-topping singer-songwriter, stage and screen actress and now book author had the place partying like it was 1989 with a performance of ‚ÄúElectric Youth,‚Äù the title track from her sophomore album. Gibson worked the keys, busted some dance moves, and looked heathier than most of us in the shadows of Christmas, as she hit an uptempo version of her top 40 hit, with support from the Cletones. “Electric Youth” gives its name to Eternally Electric (subtitled The Message in My Music ), her new memoir. ‚ÄúIt felt like right now ‚Ä¶ this is my true second act,‚Äù Gibson recently told Billboard of Eternally Electric , published by Gallery Books, a division of Simon & Shuster. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been for about five, six years. It really has been this rebuilding time and this reconnecting time with my audience. It just felt like a really fun perspective to be in the middle of it, and for the party to be going ‚Äî not to be like, ‚ÄòI‚Äôm going to sit back now in old age and reflect on the good old days.‚Äô These are the good old days that I‚Äôm living right now.‚Äù ‚ÄúElectric Youth‚Äù peaked at‚Ä¶

title: Katy Perry Wraps ‚ÄòLifetimes‚Äô Tour With $134 Million In Ticket¬†Sales
summary: The pop superstar's 'Lifetimes' tour concluded last month with more than $134 million total gross ticket sales, reps tell Billboard.
body: The numbers are in for Katy Perry ‚Äôs Lifetimes tour, which wrapped last month with more than $134 million total gross ticket sales, according to figures provided by her management. All told, the trek shifted upwards of 1.05 million tickets from 91 shows in Asia, Australia, Europe, North America and South America, and raised hundreds of thousands of dollars for good causes. In the United States, fans generated more than $264,000 for Perry‚Äôs Firework Foundation , which aims to empower children from underserved communities through arts initiatives. And in the United Kingdom, north of ¬£81,000 ($109,000) was secured for the Music Venue Trust , the charitable organization that protects, secures and improves the country‚Äôs grassroots music venues. Live Nation backed the U.S. and Canada legs of the tour, which officially launched April 23 in Mexico City, and wrapped up Dec. 7 in Abu Dhabi — a seven-and-a-half month jaunt. Along the way, Perry stopped by 23 countries, including China, where she performed six shows. Those concerts in China — two in Hangzhou, three in Shanghai and one in Haikou — sold out one minute after going on sale, Perry‚Äôs reps tell Billboard . The Life‚Ä¶

title: Algae Swirls Across a South African Reservoir
summary: Vivid green blooms form, drift, and fade in Hartbeespoortdam reservoir over the course of a year.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Algae Swirls Across a South‚Ä¶ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Search Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe üõú RSS Contact Us To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video June 2022-July 2023 NASA Earth Observatory / Lauren Dauphin On clear days in Hartbeespoort, South Africa, satellite images often reveal a reservoir with shades of deep blue interrupted by drifting patches of vivid green. These shifting features indicate algae blooms, which can affect water quality, ecosystems, and nearby human communities. In this animation, from June 2022 to July 2023, an algal bloom grows, moves around the reservoir, and then fades. The animation is composed of images from Harmonized Landsat and Sentinel-2 (HLS), a NASA product that combines imagery from the NASA/USGS L‚Ä¶

title: Banjoist B√©la Fleck Pulls Out of Kennedy Center¬†Concert
summary: The 19-time Grammy Award-winning banjoist and bandleader was booked to play with the National Symphony Orchestra in February.
body: B√©la Fleck is the latest artist to cancel his appearance at the Kennedy Center, citing the ‚Äúcharged and political‚Äù atmosphere that now hangs over the institution. The 19-time Grammy Award-winning banjoist and bandleader was booked to play with the National Symphony Orchestra in February, but is now part of a growing artist exodus, triggered by president Donald Trump‚Äôs takeover. ‚ÄúI have withdrawn from my upcoming performance with the NSO at The Kennedy Center,‚Äù reads a social post from Fleck. ‚ÄúPerforming there has become charged and political, at an institution where the focus should be on the music. I look forward to playing with the NSO another time in the future when we can together share and celebrate art.‚Äù I have withdrawn from my upcoming performance with the NSO at The Kennedy Center. Performing there has become charged and political, at an institution where the focus should be on the music. I look forward to playing with the NSO another time in the future when we can together‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/dnzoAZzzAF — B√©la Fleck (@belafleckbanjo) January 6, 2026 As previously reported , the month of December was an particularly eventful one for the Kennedy Center , during which ti‚Ä¶

title: Gwyneth Paltrow Says She Was Fired From a Movie Due to Backlash Over Chris Martin ‚ÄòConscious Uncoupling‚Äô: ‚ÄòIt Was So Personal for¬†People‚Äô
summary: "I think the distributor was like, 'This might be too hot to touch,'" Paltrow tells Amy Poehler during Good Hang podcast interview.
body: When Gwyneth Paltrow and Coldplay frontman Chris Martin announced in 2014 they were separating after more than a decade of marriage, their joint statement infamously introduced a two-word phrase to the pop-culture vernacular: “conscious uncoupling.” It feels quaint now to look back on a time before we knew the term — which refers to a relatively amicable breakup or divorce — but at the time, the exes faced a lot of backlash in the media for what was perceived as a self-important way to describe a split. In fact, the response was so negative that Paltrow says she lost a job over it. Related Gwyneth Paltrow Says Chris Martin Has ‘a Real Sweetness’ in His Parenting Style: ‘He Comes & Sprinkles Fairy Dust’ Coldplay Sweeps Year-End Billboard Boxscore Charts ‚Äì Again Gwyneth Paltrow Joins Astronomer as ‘Temporary Spokesperson’ After Coldplay Kiss Cam Scandal The Oscar-winning actress and entrepreneur appears on the latest episode of Amy Poehler’s Good Hang podcast, and the surprising anecdote came when the Saturday Night Live alum asked Paltrow if she’d ever been fired. After sharing a story of los‚Ä¶

title: Let there be light! Wireless light-based Li-Fi looks to solve some of Wi-Fi‚Äôs problems
summary: While limited by direct line-of-sight, Li-Fi is also a lot less vulnerable to interception and jamming.
body: TL;DR Li-Fi is a wireless data system remarkably similar to Wi-Fi, but uses light to send information. Data rates can hit a gigabit a second, while maintaining line-of-sight privacy. pureLiFi is showing off a home solution for using Li-Fi to send data through windows, for outside 5G reception. Old-school smartphone fans didn‚Äôt get started using a Galaxy, iPhone, or even a Nexus ‚Äî back before smartphones as we know them first took form, we had the PDA. But prior to ubiquitous cellular connectivity, communication with PDAs was always a bit of a struggle. One of the more unique solutions to emerge was IrDA, employing infrared light to wirelessly transfer information between devices. Now, over 20 years later, we‚Äôre wondering if light-based wireless communication could be about to make a return. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Lenovo is on a roll at CES: Two new rollable concepts, including one for gamers
summary: Lenovo has been working on rollables for a while, but now it has two new concepts around it.
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WFMfJDAXUow TL;DR Lenovo showcased two new rollable laptop concepts at CES 2026, one aimed at business users and another designed for high-end esports gaming. The ThinkPad Rollable XD Concept focuses on productivity, featuring a 13.3-inch display that expands to about 16 inches, plus a smaller rear screen for collaboration and more. The Legion Pro Rollable Concept targets gamers, starting at 16 inches and expanding up to 24 inches, with top-tier specs based on the Legion Pro 7i and a dual-motor rollable display system. Lenovo has been experimenting with rollable display technology for years. We have seen several concept devices during that time, and last year the company launched its first commercial laptop with a rollable screen in the form of the Lenovo ThinkBook Plus Gen 6 . It now seems clear that Lenovo is just getting started. At CES 2026 , the company showed off two new rollable laptop concepts, each aimed at a very different type of user. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Move over, Galaxy Z Fold 7 ‚Äî Motorola just entered the big-fold battle
summary: With strong-looking triple cameras and stylus support, the Razr Fold could be a promising new foldable.
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WFMfJDAXUow TL;DR Motorola announced its first book-style foldable phone, the Razr Fold, at CES 2026. It features an 8.1-inch inner display, a large cover screen, triple rear cameras, and Moto Pen support. Set to launch in summer 2026 in the US, pricing and specs like the chipset are yet to be revealed. It‚Äôs been nearly six years since Motorola resurrected the Razr, and it‚Äôs fast become one of our favorite series of flip phones, especially with last year‚Äôs Razr Ultra . At CES 2026 , Motorola revealed that the Razr family will be expanding with the Razr Fold, a book-style foldable to take on competitors like the Galaxy Z Fold 7 and Pixel 10 Pro Fold . Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Lenovo unveils a high-power GaN charger and a new combo power bank at CES 2026
summary: Lenovo‚Äôs latest charging gear focuses on power and portability.
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WFMfJDAXUow TL;DR Lenovo is adding two new charging accessories to its CES 2026 lineup: a 100W multi-port GaN charger and a 140W combo charger and power bank. The 100W charger can handle laptops and phones simultaneously, featuring three USB-C ports with adjustable power levels. The 140W Combo Power Bank serves as both a wall charger and a portable battery, featuring a built-in screen for displaying basic charging information. CES isn‚Äôt just about cutting-edge new laptops, and Lenovo is also using the show to update its charging accessories . Alongside new Yoga and IdeaPad hardware, Lenovo is launching two new power products designed to simplify how you charge multiple devices. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: I tried Motorola‚Äôs new Razr Fold, and now I‚Äôm worried about it
summary: I have high hopes, but also more than a few concerns.
body: I take great pride in my reputation as the ‚Äòflip phone guy‚Äô here at Android Authority . Whenever someone needs to go to bat for the small, pocket-friendly form factor, you can almost guarantee that it‚Äôll be me. And yes, that means I‚Äôll be the one to beat the drum for Motorola‚Äôs Razr ‚Äî especially the Razr Ultra ‚Äî harder than anyone. I think it offers the best mix of hardware and software on a flip phone, especially its cover screen. Now, there‚Äôs a new Razr that I should be throwing my support behind. Motorola has just announced its first book-style foldable, the Razr Fold, and I know I should be excited, but I‚Äôm not sure I can be ‚Äî at least not yet. I still have many questions about how the Razr Fold will compete with the likes of the Galaxy Z Fold and Pixel Pro Fold, and I‚Äôm concerned it may not find a large enough audience.

title: Lenovo Legion 7a debuts with thinner and lighter design, alongside a few other gaming machines
summary: Lenovo Legion 7a debuted at CES 2026 with a thinner and lighter design, alongside several other Legion and LOQ products.
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WFMfJDAXUow TL;DR Lenovo is refreshing the Legion 7a, 5i, and 5a at CES 2026. The Legion 7a is the highest-end model, with support for up to the AMD Ryzen Z2 Extreme processor and GeForce RTX 5060 laptop GPU. In addition to the Legion, Lenovo is also refreshing its budget-level LOQ series as well. Lenovo is known for a wide portfolio of computing products that cater to just about everyone, from casual users to business professionals, and even gamers. At CES 2026, the company is refreshing many of its best products across all categories. We‚Äôve already looked at a few of its new Yoga devices ; now it‚Äôs time to take a closer look at the Legion family. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Live Nation Signs Deal to Acquire Paris La D√©fense Arena, Largest Indoor Venue in¬†Europe
summary: The touring giant plans to launch a "major upgrade programme" for the arena once the deal closes.
body: Live Nation has signed a deal to acquire Paris La D√©fense Arena, Europe’s largest indoor venue, from Ovalto, the concert giant announced Tuesday (Jan. 6). Upon closure of the deal ‚Äî which is subject to approval from the French Competition Authority ‚Äî Live Nation will launch a “major upgrade programme,” according to a press release, that will allow the venue to host more productions year-round. Since it opened in 2017, the arena has hosted shows by artists including Bruce Springsteen, The Rolling Stones, Kendrick Lamar, Taylor Swift, Hans Zimmer and Dua Lipa, along with the Olympic Games and the Tour de France. Related The 10 Biggest Live Music Stories of 2025: Live Nation Lawsuits, Ticket Prices & More Kennedy Center President to 'Seek $1 Million in Damages' From Jazz Musician Who Called Off Christmas Eve Show Diddy Seeks Immediate Release From Prison in Appeals Argument The release adds that Live Nation will continue to promote shows at other major French venues, including LDLC Arena, Accor Arena and Stade de France, while welcoming “all promoters” to Paris La D√©fense Arena. ‚ÄúOur ambition is simple: to make Paris La D√©fense Arena a‚Ä¶

title: Watch Cardi B Begin Little Miss Drama Tour Rehearsals: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm Finding the¬†Pocket‚Äô
summary: Cardi's first headlining arena trek kicks off Feb. 11 in Palm Desert, California.
body: Cardi B is gearing up for her first headlining arena trek, with just over a month until her Little Miss Drama Tour kicks off in Palm Desert, California, on Feb. 11. As the calendar turns to 2026, Cardi started tour rehearsals on Tuesday (Jan. 6), and she posted a clip on her Instagram Story working on some choreography with a couple of back-up dancers in the studio. Cardi knows the pressure’s on to deliver in her first time on the road. Last month, she got emotional posting to social media after seeing fans gift tickets to her tour for Christmas to friends and famil‚Ä¶

summary: A complete rundown of the most important events across the music business.
body: As part of our continuing efforts to serve the music industry and its creators, Billboard Pro now features a music industry events calendar for readers. The calendar will act as music’s most complete summary major national and international industry events, from conferences to festivals to networking mixers and more. Just as Billboard is music’s must-read source for news, charts and analysis, now it also is the go-to for business happenings. title: Google VP confirms not all Chromebooks will be able to migrate to Aluminium OS
summary: Google VP reaffirms Chrome OS commitment amid shift to Aluminium OS.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR The vice president of product management for Chrome OS says Google isn‚Äôt giving up on the operating system. The executive also confirmed that the company will continue to honor its commitment to support Chromebooks with 10 years of automatic updates. Not all Chromebooks will be able to migrate over to Aluminium OS due to technical limitations. It has been known for a while that Google plans to merge Chrome OS and Android into a single desktop platform, codenamed ‚Äú Aluminium OS .‚Äù Unsurprisingly, this knowledge has led to many questions about the fate of Chromebooks and Chrome OS. In an attempt to ease the uncertainty, a Google executive sat down to answer a few questions about the future of the platform. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Meet the Pocket Taco, your next retro mobile gaming controller
summary: This $35 controller brings retro vibes to Android and iOS gaming.
body: Credit: GameSir TL;DR Gaming hardware and accessory maker GameSir has announced its latest mobile controller, the Pocket Taco. Previously known as the Pocket 1, the Pocket Taco is a Game Boy-inspired vertical mobile game controller that clips onto the bottom of your phone. The controller is available for preorder on the company‚Äôs website for $34.99. When it comes to mobile gaming controllers, they‚Äôre a dime a dozen. With options from Backbone, ASUS, Abxylute, 8BitDo, and plenty of others, it can be hard to stand out from the pack. However, GameSir‚Äôs latest controller does its best to be a unique offering by tugging on your nostalgia strings. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: This adorable interactive fuzzball wants to be your emotional ally
summary: A cellular upgrade transforms Fuzozo into an emotional partner that's always there when you need it.
body: TL;DR Fuzozo is a sort of half-pet, half-emotional-support-buddy, packed into a Furby-like package. A new upgrade gives Fuzozo cellular connectivity, ensuring access to its AI-based features even when away from home. Over time, users can help their Fuzozo develop a unique personality, and hopefully form an emotional bond. Life in the modern era can be lonely. For many of us, the pandemic really crystalized just how important it is to maintain meaningful connections, but sometimes that‚Äôs easier said than done. If you‚Äôve been struggling to find a fellow human shoulder to lean on, what about the next best thing ‚Äî an AI-powered emotional partner? This year at CES, Tuya and Robopoet are showing off an adorable little fluffball that‚Äôs designed to offer just that. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Breaking: Google will now only release Android source code twice a year
summary: Google has announced that it will publish Android source code to AOSP in Q2 and Q4 of each year.
body: The operating system that powers every Android phone and tablet on the market is based on AOSP , short for the Android Open Source Project. Google develops and releases AOSP under the permissive Apache 2.0 License, which allows any developer to use, modify, and distribute their own operating systems based on the project without paying fees or releasing their own modified source code. Since beginning the project, Google released the source code for nearly every new version of Android for mobile devices, typically doing so within days of rolling out the corresponding update to its own Pixel mobile devices. Starting this year, however, Google is making a major change to its release schedule for Android source code drops: AOSP sources will only be released twice a year. Google told Android Authority that, effective 2026, Google will publish new source code to AOSP in Q2 and Q4. The reason is to ensure platform stability for the Android ecosystem and better align with Android‚Äôs trunk-stable development model . Developers navigating to source.android.com today will see a banner confirming the change that reads as follows:

title: Google and XREAL are doubling down on their Android XR partnership
summary: Google picks XREAL to lead its Android XR hardware ambitions.
body: TL;DR XREAL and Google have announced a multi-year extension of their partnership. XREAL will now be the lead hardware partner for the Android XR ecosystem. The two companies plan to work on more ‚Äúoptical-see-through devices,‚Äù including wired XR glasses. CES is in full swing and extended reality (XR) device maker XREAL has been busy. Yesterday, the company pulled the covers off its latest pair of XR glasses, the ROG XREAL R1 . Today, the firm has another announcement that involves its future with Google. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: I went hands-on with the Galaxy Z TriFold at CES 2026: The future is here, but also not
summary: An engineering marvel, that feels like a restart.
body: When the original Galaxy Fold landed years ago, it was a clunky, fragile promise of things to come. It took Samsung six years to refine that vision into the Galaxy Z Fold 7 , a device that finally felt thin, light, and ‚Äúnormal.‚Äù Now, here at CES 2026 , I‚Äôve just gone hands-on with the new Samsung Galaxy Z TriFold. It promises to be the next great leap forward: a phone that unfolds not just once, but twice, turning into a legitimate 10-inch tablet.

title: These smart glasses ditch speakers and cameras to focus on real-time translation with captions
summary: Offering near-instant translation for 100+ languages.
body: Credit: Chase Bernath / Android Authority TL;DR LLVision has launched Leion Hey 2 smart glasses that offer real-time translations with subtitles displayed in the lenses. The smart glasses support translations for over 100 languages and are claimed to take less than 500ms to interpret the input. The glasses lack any speakers or cameras to focus on minimal visual cues. For yet another year, we‚Äôre seeing sweeping momentum at CES for gadgets that use AI in some way. At CES 2026 , smart or AR (augmented reality) glasses have been the clear choice for many brands to showcase their strides in AI. LLVision is throwing its hat in the ring, too, with a showcase of its Leion Hey 2 smart glasses at CES 2026. LLVision positions these smart glasses for professional use, with a heavy focus on translation. As per the announcement, the Leion Hey 2 glasses support over ‚Äú100 languages and dialects‚Äù and offer real-time translation with less than half a second of processing delay.

title: Gemini has entered the projector chat
summary: Epson‚Äôs Lifestudio projectors get a Gemini upgrade at CES 2026.
body: TL;DR Epson announces Google TV with Gemini integration for select Lifestudio projectors. Gemini brings more conversational voice control, fine-tuned browsing, and smart-home controls. The rollout begins with newer Lifestudio models and will expand across the entire lineup in 2026. As projectors strive to close the gap with TVs, bigger screens and better brightness are no longer enough; software matters too. Today at CES 2026 , Epson announced that select Lifestudio projectors will soon integrate Google TV with Gemini, bringing Google‚Äôs more conversational AI assistant to the brand‚Äôs big-screen lineup. Gemini has been quietly expanding across Google‚Äôs ecosystem, and the company already announced that Gemini is coming to projectors . Projectors are finally getting software that doesn‚Äôt feel like a compromise compared to modern TVs.

title: Your future color E-Ink wall gallery just got even bigger
summary: InkPoster‚Äôs new A1 frames introduce poster-sized ePaper art.
body: TL;DR InkPoster launched two new A1-sized color E-Ink frames at CES 2026. Both use E-Ink Spectra 6 color ePaper for a print-like impression, but feature differing aesthetics. The poster-sized frames are designed to function as fully cordless wall art, with up to a year of battery life. Color E-Ink isn‚Äôt just for E-Ink tablets anymore, and wall art is one of the more logical places it‚Äôs showing up. The tech offers the flexibility of digital art without the glow, noise, or constant power draw of a traditional screen. After launching its first consumer-friendly color ePaper art poster in 2025, InkPoster returns to CES 2026 with two new A1-size frames that scale the idea up in a big way. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: The Google Pixel Buds Pro 2 are cheaper than they were on Black Friday right now
summary: We love these buds at full price, so they're a strong recommendation at $64 off.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority It‚Äôs rare to find better deals in the January lull than during the Black Friday frenzy, but it does happen now and then. For example, the Pixel Buds Pro 2 are currently available for $165 on Amazon, a significant drop from their original $229 list price and cheaper than they were during the November madness. The absolute lowest price we‚Äôve tracked is $160, which only appeared for a single day last summer, so this is about as close as it gets. Pixel Buds Pro 2 for $165.04 ($64 off)

title: Hohem‚Äôs latest gimbal lets you film smooth shoots from over 30 feet away
summary: This smart new gimbal can track just about anything you film.
body: iSteady MT3 Pro Credit: Hohem TL;DR Hohem has announced two new iSteady MT3 gimbals. The MT3 Pro offers AI tracking, a detachable touchscreen remote, fast vertical switching, and 20 hours of battery life. The base MT3 offers human-only AI tracking, fast vertical switching, and 17 hours of battery life. Hohem announced a fairly unique-sounding external storage device today. But that wasn‚Äôt the only announcement the brand had in store for CES 2026 . The company is also adding two new camera gimbals to its lineup. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: First Sky Map from NASA‚Äôs SPHEREx Observatory
summary: NASA‚Äôs SPHEREx Observatory has mapped the entire sky in 102 infrared colors, as seen here in this image released on Dec. 18, 2025. This image features a selection of colors emitted primarily by stars (blue, green, and white), hot hydrogen gas (blue), and cosmic dust (red). While not visible to the ‚Ä¶
body: NASA‚Äôs SPHEREx Observatory has mapped the entire sky in 102 infrared colors, as seen here in this image released on Dec. 18, 2025. This image features a selection of colors emitted primarily by stars (blue, green, and white), hot hydrogen gas (blue), and cosmic dust (red). NASA/JPL-Caltech NASA‚Äôs SPHEREx Observatory has mapped the entire sky in 102 infrared colors , as seen here in this image released on Dec. 18, 2025. This image features a selection of colors emitted primarily by stars (blue, green, and white), hot hydrogen gas (blue), and cosmic dust (red). While not visible to the human eye, these 102 infrared wavelengths of light are prevalent in the cosmos, and observing the entire sky this way enables scientists to answer big questions, including how a dramatic event that occurred in the first billionth of a trillionth of a trillionth of a second after the big bang influenced the 3D distribution of hundreds of millions of galaxies in our universe. In addition, scientists will use the data to study how galaxies have changed over the universe‚Äôs nearly 14-billion-year history and learn about the distribution of key ingredients for life in our own galaxy. Image credit: NASA/JPL-‚Ä¶

title: Don‚Äôt want to pay for YouTube Premium? Morphe picks up where Revanced left off.
summary: From ad-blocking to disabling Shorts, this alternative to the official YouTube app is worth a look.
body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR Several Revanced developers and contributors have left the project and released the Morphe app. This app patches YouTube and YouTube Music to enable various features that ordinarily require Premium or browser add-ons. Update: January 7, 2026 (6:03 AM ET): We erroneously linked to an unofficial Morphe website in our original article below. We‚Äôve since updated the article with a link to the official Morphe website (morphe.software rather than morpheapp.software). We apologize for the error. Original article: January 6, 2026 (8:58 AM ET): There are several notable alternatives to the official YouTube app, and Revanced is one of the most popular choices. However, a new third-party alternative is making waves online.

title: Garmin finally adds native food tracking, but you‚Äôll have to pay for it
summary: Garmin puts food tracking behind its Connect+ subscription.
body: Credit: Garmin TL;DR Garmin finally integrates full nutrition tracking directly into the Garmin Connect app, announced at CES 2026. You can see calories burned and consumed together, log macros, and connect meals directly to training, recovery, and sleep inside Garmin Connect. Garmin‚Äôs Active Intelligence ties what you eat to how you recover and sleep, surfacing insights like how late meals may impact rest. If you use your Garmin watch to track runs, sleep, and stress but log your food in a different app, Garmin is making things easier. At CES 2026 , the company announced a big update to Garmin Connect that now includes full nutrition tracking. According to Garmin‚Äôs press release , you can now view both burned and consumed calories in one place, get AI insights on how your diet impacts recovery, and see how your meals relate to your performance.

title: OnePlus 16 leak hints at a new ‚ÄòPro‚Äô or ‚ÄòUltra‚Äô model to rival the best of Android
summary: The company is reportedly shifting strategy to release a high-end "all-rounder" in late 2026.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR OnePlus is reportedly considering a ‚ÄúPro‚Äù or ‚ÄúUltra‚Äù model for the first time since 2022. Leaks suggest that the 2026 flagship will be an ‚Äúall-rounder‚Äù that has evolved based on current customer feedback. The rumored device is expected to arrive in Q4 2026, in line with the company‚Äôs conventional yearly release cycle. OnePlus had an interesting 2025. The company started strong with the OnePlus 13, 13R, and 13s, but then came along the OnePlus 15 and 15R , which left behind some of the highlights of their predecessors. While the new phones are only a few months old at this point, leaks have already begun to emerge for the successor to the OnePlus 15, and it appears the company could right some wrongs this year. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: The ayes have it: An overwhelming majority of you want this Android Auto feature
summary: Even if you truly don't need it. Or do you?
body: Credit: Andy Walker / Android Authority Most modern cars feature large touchscreens for head units these days. So it‚Äôs natural for anyone to want to use the space to play videos. However, as we established recently, doing so isn‚Äôt exactly as easy or straightforward as you might imagine it to be. While it‚Äôs understandable to restrict video playback to prevent it from distracting users, there‚Äôs no reason it should restrict playback when the car is stationary or has its ignition turned off. Google, if it wanted, could place curbs on watching videos when it detects the car in motion. It already does that by preventing users from using the physical keyboard to search for a destination in Google Maps when the vehicle is in motion, and instead only allows using voice for search.

title: Score 52% off the Samsung 55-inch Odyssey Ark curved gaming monitor
summary: Samsung‚Äôs 1000R-curved Mini-LED monitor has never been cheaper.

If you‚Äôre staring down some long evenings indoors, it might be the perfect excuse to treat yourself to a serious upgrade for your gaming rig. Samsung‚Äôs 55-inch Odyssey Ark 2nd Gen curved gaming monitor is currently on sale on Amazon for $1,299.99, marking the lowest price the screen has ever reached on the platform. Samsung 55-inch Odyssey Ark curved gaming monitor for $1,299.99 ($1,400 off)

title: Did you know: Samsung once burned 150,000 phones just to make a point
summary: It was a bold move, but it worked.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority Actions speak louder than words. That was the mindset of Samsung‚Äôs late Chairman, Lee Kun-hee . Back in the 90s, he was fed up with the company‚Äôs direction. He was a man obsessed with quality, which was something Samsung wasn‚Äôt exactly known for in those days. In 1995, when defect rates for Samsung‚Äôs phones hit an all-time high, Lee figured out that all those speeches about quality he was making weren‚Äôt having the effect he was hoping for. So, he decided to make his point with a move so bold it became company legend: he gathered a few thousand employees in a factory courtyard and burned 150,000 Samsung phones right in front of them.

title: Samsung‚Äôs upcoming Galaxy Buds 4 Pro may arrive in a special fruity color
summary: Not inspired by THAT fruit, though!
body: Credit: AssembleDebug / Android Authority TL;DR Samsung‚Äôs Galaxy Buds 4 Pro may have a third color option. In addition to the already-leaked black and white colorways, the Galaxy Buds 4 Pro may also come in an ‚ÄúApricot‚Äù colorway. The special color appears limited to the Pro variant for now, with no hints for the regular model. Unlike its phones, which get updated every year, Samsung maintains a longer upgrade cycle for its premium wireless earbuds. The Galaxy Buds 3 series was released nearly 18 months ago, which means the Galaxy Buds 4 should arrive soon. Although we aren‚Äôt clear on the timeline just yet, we‚Äôve been seeing several references to the Galaxy Buds 4 and the Buds 4 Pro in Samsung‚Äôs One UI firmware for phones. While we recently learned about changes to the earbuds‚Äô battery capacities and new head gestures , the recently released One UI 8.5 beta 3 provides more details. title: As RAM costs drive up prices, this budget-friendly phone challenges the need for a flagship
summary: This killer mid-range phone features a curved AMOLED display, fast reverse charging, and IP66 rating.
body: Credit: Aamir Siddiqui / Android Authority TL;DR Xiaomi has launched the Redmi Note 15 5G, featuring a slim design and a curved display that is typically reserved for Pro-tier models. Key specs include a Snapdragon 6 Gen 3 SoC, a 108MP primary camera, IP66 water resistance, and a 5,520mAh battery, all packed into this slim chassis. With phones set to become more expensive this year due to the RAM crisis, an increasing number of consumers are expected to turn to mid-range Android phones . It also makes sense, as these phones can serve most people‚Äôs needs just fine at a fraction of the price of flagship phones. Xiaomi is gearing up to meet these needs with the launch of the Redmi Note 15 series, starting with the base model, the Redmi Note 15 5G.

title: This is how much Motorola‚Äôs first book-style foldable phone could cost
summary: The Razr Fold is already shaping to be one of the most competitive foldable phones of 2026.
body: Credit: Evan Blass TL;DR Tipster Evan Blass has leaked the alleged US price of the upcoming Motorola Razr Fold. It‚Äôs Motorola‚Äôs first book-style foldable, and according to Blass, it could come in at an aggressive price of $1,500, undercutting rivals like Samsung and Google. Blass also shared that AT&T might soon remove Motorola phones from its lineup. The Motorola Razr Fold is one of the most talked-about devices right now, thanks to numerous leaks from reliable tipster Evan Blass. After outing the complete design of the phone (see leaked image above), Blass now claims to know the phone‚Äôs price, and it‚Äôs way more aggressively than we expected.

title: No console, no problem: Xbox Game Pass is coming to Google TV this year
summary: TCL says its bringing Xbox Game Pass to its flagship Google TV-powered televisions later this year.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR It looks like Google TV will finally gain support for Xbox Game Pass this year. TCL has announced that the Xbox app is coming to its flagship X11L TVs via an OTA update. It‚Äôs unclear whether support will also be headed to the Google TV Streamer or other Google TV-powered devices. TCL just unveiled its new X11L flagship TV series at CES 2026. These Google TV -powered televisions not only feature the new Gemini for TV experience, but apparently, they‚Äôll also be the first ones to bring Xbox Game Pass to the Google TV platform later this year.

title: Samsung just showed a foldable screen with no crease, and it looks unreal!
summary: Could this be the Galaxy Z Fold 8's killer upgrade? We sure hope so.
body: TL;DR Samsung Display is showcasing a new foldable OLED at CES 2026 that appears completely crease-free. The display reportedly features a new metal plate design that reduces stress during folding, thereby removing the visible crease. This panel could show up in the Galaxy Z Fold 8 and may also be used in Apple‚Äôs first foldable iPhone. Foldable phones have come a long way, but there‚Äôs one design flaw that refuses to go away ‚Äî the crease in the middle of the screen. At CES 2026 , Samsung Display may have finally cracked that problem. At its booth on the show floor of the tech show, Samsung Display is showcasing a brand-new foldable OLED panel that appears to have no visible crease at all. According to SamMobile , the difference is immediately noticeable when the new display is placed next to the one used on the Galaxy Z Fold 7 .

title: Acer Nitro and Aspire get an AMD-powered upgrade at CES
summary: There are no massive refreshes here, but still appears to be a nice incremental upgrade.
body: Credit: Acer TL;DR Acer is refreshing several of its laptop lines with the latest AMD processors at CES 2026, including the Nitro V 16 AI. The Nitro V 16 AI includes support for up to the Ryzen AI 9 465 and up to the NVIDIA GeForce 5070. The Acer Aspire series and Swift Go will also receive AMD refreshes this year, although pricing and exact launch dates are currently unknown. Acer is known for producing a wide range of laptops across every segment, from business to gaming and everything in between. There is also often a variety of configurations featuring both AMD and Intel chips. Unfortunately, with so many options available, it can be difficult to keep track. For AMD fans, the most notable refresh at CES 2026 is the new Acer Nitro V 16 AI (ANV16-A71). Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: A year after killing it, Dell brings back XPS line and it‚Äôs better than ever
summary: The new models are completely rebuilt from the ground up and aren't just minor refreshes.
body: TL;DR After announcing its retirement at CES 2025, Dell has reversed course and confirmed XPS will return as its flagship premium laptop brand, starting with redesigned XPS 14 and XPS 16 models. The new XPS laptops feature Intel Core Ultra Series 3 processors, Intel Arc integrated graphics, OLED or 2K LCD display options, a lighter unibody CNC aluminum design, improved repairability, and numerous other upgrades. Limited XPS 14 and 16 configurations will be available on January 6, with additional configurations starting in February. The XPS 13 is also expected later this year, but there‚Äôs no clear timeframe yet. Last year at CES, Dell announced the retirement of several classic brands , including the beloved XPS series. Exactly a year later, the company returns to the famed trade show with a bit of a course reversal. During its CES 2026 reveal, Dell announced that the XPS will return as its flagship brand for its premium laptops. While Dell promises the XPS 13 will eventually debut as a more affordable entry point later this year, for now, the company is focusing on the XPS 14 and XPS 16 as its core models. Both core models will feature the latest Intel Core Ultra Series 3 processo‚Ä¶

title: Acer unveils 1,000Hz gaming monitor, but you probably don‚Äôt want to run it at that refresh rate
summary: Though you might still love it at 500Hz.
body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority TL;DR Acer‚Äôs lineup for CES 2026 includes a monitor that can run at up to 1,000Hz. It comes alongside a curved QD-OLED with a 360Hz refresh rate. Besides these, Acer has also announced a budget 5K monitor for gamers and a premium 6K screen for creators. Acer is kicking off 2026 with a host of new launches at CES 2026 . While its updated portfolio of gaming laptops and consumer laptops takes the center stage, the brand is also showcasing new products, including a range of desktop monitors for gamers and professional creators. That comprises new products in the Predator, Nitro, and ProDesigner series. The new lineup includes the Predator XB273U F6 and X34 F3 gaming monitors. Both of these deliver palpable smoothness for high-speed gameplay. Of the two, the XB273U F6 supports a 500Hz refresh rate at QHD resolution and can clock 1,000Hz when downscaled to 1280 x 720 pixels. It‚Äôs backed by a 27-inch QHD IPS panel with a 2,000:1 contrast ratio and a claimed brightness of 350 nits. The panel is also calibrated to cover 95% of the DCI-P3 color space for saturated tones while gaming.

title: Latest Acer Predator Helios gaming machine revealed alongside updated Nitro V family
summary: Acer has several new updates powered by the latest Intel processors here at CES 2026.
body: Credit: Acer TL;DR Acer had several new devices to show off at CES 2026, including several refreshes that utilize the latest Intel processors and Nvidia 50 series GPUs. The Predator Helios Neo 16S is one of the most important refreshes, with support for the latest Core Ultra 9 processors, the RTX 5070 GPU, and more. The Acer Nitro V 16 AI and 16S AI are also getting new Intel versions. The Predator is expected to arrive first in June or July, with the others to follow. Acer has plenty to show off at CES 2026 , including a variety of new laptops running on Intel‚Äôs latest processors. There were three models that stood out to us above the rest: the new Predator Helios Neo 16S AI, the Nitro V 16 AI, and the Nitro V 16S AI. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Chrome for Android is making it easier to access your bookmarks
summary: This Chrome for desktop feature just quietly arrived on some Android devices.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority TL;DR An option to show your bookmark bar is starting to appear for some Chrome for Android users. The option is only available on wide-screen devices, like tablets. For the most part, the Chrome browser experience is fairly similar between desktop and mobile. However, there are a few key differences, like full extension support on desktop. In a step that will bring the two even closer together, one feature that was formerly only available for desktop mode is now starting to show up on the mobile version. title: Samsung Galaxy Buds 4 Pro could see a big jump in battery life (APK teardown)
summary: The Galaxy Buds 4 Pro's biggest upgrade may be the battery.
body: Credit: AssembleDebug / Android Authority TL;DR New strings of code provide updated information on the battery capacities for the Galaxy Buds 4 and Buds 4 Pro. The Buds 4 Pro will see a significant jump in typical battery capacity compared to the Buds 3 Pro, but the Buds 4 will see a minor decrease. Another update suggests that the previously reported head gesture feature may be limited to Bixby for answering yes-or-no questions. The next generation of Samsung‚Äôs Galaxy Buds is on the way. Over the last few months, we have been uncovering a variety of information about the Galaxy Buds 4 and Buds 4 Pro. Recently, we spotted a few details about the battery capacities and a new ‚ÄúHead Gestures‚Äù feature hiding in strings of code of a leaked One UI 8.5 build. Since discovering this information, these strings have been updated to provide more details and context. At CES 2026 , Anker is unveiling a bunch of products across its brands. For eufy, the company is unveiling the new Solar Wall Light Cam S4, Video Doorbell S4, Smart Lock E40, SmartTrack Card E40 , and eufyCam C38 Pan & Tilt Wireless Camera, as well as revealing the pricing of the Omni S2 Robot Vacuum , which was launched at IFA 2025. summary: Eufy finally offers a wireless tracking card with Find Hub support.

Expect to pay $34.99 for the SmartTrack Card E40 when it goes on sale in Q1 2026. Wireless trackers are very popular today, especially in the wake of Apple‚Äôs Find My Network and Google‚Äôs Find Hub . The Nebula X1 Pro can cast a 200-inch picture and offers a wireless 7.1.4 Dolby Atmos system. It‚Äôs that time of year again, CES is here for 2026. title: Anker‚Äôs latest chargers deliver high-power options for your bag, desk, and everything in-between
summary: The brand's latest charging solutions range from super-compact to a 13-in-1 dock with detachable hub.
body: TL;DR Anker‚Äôs coming to CES with a new lineup of both mobile and desktop charging options. The new 45W Nano Charger manages to shrink compared to the 30W model, while also offering a screen. The Nano Docking Station offers a new pop-out mini hub for expansion on the go. This week, your favorite tech companies have descended upon Las Vegas to introduce their latest hardware. And there is a lot of it. No matter what new launch we‚Äôre learning about next, all of it ‚Äî from the most compact mobile accessory to the biggest EVs ‚Äî needs to get its power from somewhere. Thankfully, we‚Äôre also checking out the latest solutions from brands like Anker that are out to tackle our power needs, and at this year‚Äôs CES, Anker is showing off chargers and related accessories perfect for everywhere from your bag to your desk. title: TCL‚Äôs NXTPAPER 70 Pro wants to make your excessive screen-on time as pleasant as possible
summary: Eye-friendly, matte, and loaded with features ‚Äî TCL's NXTPAPER 70 Pro is a different kind of Android phone.
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B0S7pPrcWts TL;DR The NXTPAPER 70 Pro is TCL‚Äôs latest Android phone with an eye-friendly paper-like display. Users can quickly switch between display modes through the NXTPAPER button, including a monochrome option. Other hardware details include a 50MP main camera, Dimensity 7300 SoC, and up to 512GB storage. Screens on modern phones have become so nice that it‚Äôs easy to take them for granted. But while we‚Äôve got our pick of options with big, bright, high-refresh-rate panels, some manufacturers are trying a different approach. TCL has found success with its NXTPAPER tech , prioritizing eye comfort with matte-finish screens that offer a pleasant alternative to the shiny, glossy displays everyone else uses. And this week at CES 2026 , the company is showing off its latest NXTPAPER-based phone. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: ROG XREAL R1 AR glasses put a 240Hz gaming monitor right on your face
summary: 240Hz displays and plug-and-play compatibility with the Asus ROG Ally.
body: TL;DR At CES, XREAL announced the ROG XREAL R1 glasses, built for gaming. The new glasses feature 240Hz micro-LED displays at a resolution of 1080p per eye. The glasses are expected to go on sale in the first half of 2026. Pricing hasn‚Äôt been announced. Yesterday, AR glasses maker XREAL announced a refreshed version of its popular XREAL One glasses. The new XREAL 1S glasses improve on the original in a few ways, with a wider field of view, higher resolution, and more. Today at CES, XREAL took the wraps off another new pair of glasses: the ROG XREAL R1, a gaming-oriented pair of AR glasses made in partnership with Asus. The R1‚Äôs gaming focus comes through mainly in its refresh rate. The micro-OLED displays under the ROG XREAL R1 clock in at a blistering 240Hz, and XREAL says that the glasses have a low latency of just three milliseconds.

title: The Best Condiments for Giving as Delicious Gifts
summary: There is no better and easier gift than a really great condiment. It doesn‚Äôt matter how picky a person is, or how specific their tastes are, or how well (or little) you know them, a high quality condiment is a meal-upgrading addition to anyone‚Äôs kitchen ‚Äî even if they don‚Äôt cook. (Let‚Äôs be honest, ‚Ä¶
